kaninator.game
Class Gun

java.lang.Object
  kaninator.game.Gun

public class Gun
extends java.lang.Object

Represents the gun wielded by the player in the game. Creates Bullets and also has a graphical representation of its own.

Author:
phedman
See Also:
Bullet

Constructor Detail

Gun

public Gun(java.util.ArrayList<Animation> animList,
           SoundClip _sound,
           Map _map,
           Drawable _bullet,
           java.util.LinkedList<DynamicObject> _bulletObjects,
           double _speed)
    throws ModelException
Constructs a gun. Associates it with the resources needed to display the gun, play the a sound when it is fired and add new bullets to the game itself.

Parameters:
animList - The animations used to display the gun.
_sound - The sound to be played when the gun fires.
_map - Map used for aiming and height checking.
_bullet - The graphical representation of a bullet.
_bulletObjects - The list to which the bullets will be added.
_speed - The speed the bullets will travel at.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - If the animation is null or of the size 0, since the model cannot be created without these.
ModelException
Method Detail

setWielder

public void setWielder(DynamicObject _wielder)
Sets the wielder of the gun, to get the initial height and positions of the bullets. The gun won't function without a wielder.

Parameters:
_wielder - The DynamicObject that wields the gun.

setAim

public void setAim(double x,
                   double y,
                   double height)
Aims the gun into the direction made up by the coordinates in the parameters. In essence it treats the coordinates as a vector, normalizes them, and multiplies them with the speed of the bullet effectively creating a new aiming vector. It also decreases shoot delay for each method call.

Parameters:
x - X coordinate of the new aiming direction.
y - Y coordinate of the new aiming direction.
height - The height difference of the new aiming direction.

aimModel

public void aimModel(double vec_x,
                     double vec_y)
Updates the state (the current active animation) of the model so it corresponds with the new aiming vector.

Parameters:
vec_x - The x component of the aiming vector.
vec_y - The y component of the aiming vector.

update

public void update()
Updates the internal state of the gun. Setting its position to the wielders position. Tweaking the height and position of the DynamicObject with setHeightOffset respectively setPosOffset to preserve a reasonable drawing order.

See Also:
DynamicObject.setHeightOffset(double), DynamicObject.setPosOffset(double, double)

shoot

public void shoot()
Fires the gun. Effectively playing the SoundClip and adding a new Bullet object to the LinkedList of Bullets contained in Game. Also sets the shoot delay to SHOOT_DELAY. Will only fire if the shoot delay is zero, the shoot delay is decreased in setAim().

See Also:
setAim(double, double, double), Bullet, Game

observeBullets

public void observeBullets(java.util.LinkedList<Zombie> targets)
Loops through all the Bullets in the LinkedList and calls observe() for them: Effectively checking them for collisions and moving them.

Parameters:
targets - The LinkedList of Zombies that the Bullets should check against collisions with.
See Also:
Zombie, Bullet.observe(LinkedList), Bullet

updateBullets

public void updateBullets()
Loops through all the Bullets in the LinkedList and calls update() for them: If they return true, then delete them from the list of Bullets, and their DynamicObjects from the list of DynamicObjects.

See Also:
Bullet, Bullet.update()

getMainObject

public DynamicObject getMainObject()
Gets the DynamicObject representing the Gun.

Returns:
The DynamicObject containing the Animations for the gun.
